0,Project Overview,media/superfund_pic.png,Image Source: U.S Environmental Protection Agency,https://www.epa.gov/mo/celebrating-10-years-tribes-cleanup-partnership-tar-creek-superfund-site,"Minority populations have a history of being disproportionately exposed to environmental issues, including hazardous waste like Superfund sites. In addition, there are many studies that support that minority populations are also more susceptible to negative environmental health impacts as a result. North Carolina has a total of 38 active Superfund sites, more than many other states. Being the birthplace of the Environmental Justice movement, North Carolina has a unique history of minority communities being unfairly exposed to hazardous waste.This raises the question if these inequalities are still present today. This project aims to examine Superfund site distribution in relation to minority populations in North Carolina, and determine whether sites are unequally concentrated in minority communities across the state.
